name: Verde
headline: Digital lending platform for Brazilian farmers
description: Verde is a lending platform that offers fast loans to small-and-medium sized farmers in Brazil. Our vertical software allows independent ag loan advisors to originate loans digitally and manage their operations more effectively.

founders.name: Lucas Martins, Founder
founders.description:
Founded Verde to help Brazilian farmers grow their business through financal services.
As a rancher myself, decided to follow this passion after spending half of my career with one of the leading fintech companies in Brazil, and the other half in investment banking.

founders.name: Jorge Silveira, Founder
founders.description: As a grandson of farmers and software engineer for the past 20 years, founded Verde to combine my two greatest passions, agriculture and technology, to help small and medium farmers in Brazil.

generated_description:
Let’s talk about Verde, a company that’s shaking up the way Brazilian farmers access funding. Founded in 2021 and proudly part of Y Combinator's S21 batch, Verde operates out of São Paulo with a small but mighty team of 13.

Verde is positioned in the ever-evolving fintech landscape as a digital lending platform specifically aimed at small and medium-sized farmers. The mission? To make agricultural credit swift, straightforward, and fully digital. In a sector where time is often synonymous with money, Verde offers a refreshing alternative to traditional lending, which can be slow and burdensome.

What’s unique about Verde is its vertical software that empowers independent agricultural loan advisors. This technology enables these advisors to originate loans online and manage their operations more effectively. Essentially, Verde is enabling advisors to be more efficient, which translates into faster services for the farmers who rely on them.

Clients can expect quick access to credit without the usual headaches that come with borrowing. Verde has cut through the unnecessary red tape, allowing farmers the freedom to negotiate on their own terms and choose the suppliers they need without limitations. Flexibility is key, whether it’s for operational costs, capital needs, or seasonal expenditures.

With over 100 specialized advisors already supportive of the Verde model, the platform provides a comprehensive digital experience—from the comfort of your farm. These advisors are not just there to push loans but to genuinely help farmers find the best financial solutions tailored to their specific needs.

Why is this important? The agricultural world in Brazil, as in many places, often faces challenges with access to credit, transparency in rates, and timely disbursement of funds. Verde is addressing these pain points head-on, aiming to liberate farmers from the shackles of outdated financial processes.

If you’re interested in learning more about how Verde operates or if you’re a farmer looking for options in agricultural finance, they’ve made it easy to get in touch. Just head to their website: [Verde](https://www.verde.agr.br).

All in all, Verde is not just another fintech company; it's a forward-looking platform dedicated to enhancing the lives of Brazilian farmers, giving them the financial tools they need to thrive in a competitive landscape.
